description: Web development has evolved rapidly in recent years. This course will give you an overview of the technologies used in modern web development as well as the skills required to assemble a first-class development team.
name: Web Development: Executive Briefing

description: For the beginner, starting to learn web development can be daunting. In this course, Shawn Wildermuth shows you step-by-step how to use client-side web development techniques to create immersive web sites.
name: Front-End Web Development Quick Start With HTML5, CSS, and JavaScript

description: Learn all the basics of front end web development.
name: Front End Web Development: Get Started

description: Making an ASP.NET web app used to be so simple. This course will walk you through recent developments in web technologies so that you can choose which ones are relevant for you to learn.
name: Beyond ASP.NET MVC: Modern Web Development Demystified

description: Learn how to build web apps using Python and WEB2PY framework.
name: Full Stack Web Development with Python (WEB2PY)

description: Learn the React way to build rich interactive UIs using both class and function components with React Hooks, and build a game for kids with it.
name: React: Getting Started

description: Introduction to Web Development is a one-stop course that covers all of the tools you’ll need to create websites.
name: Introduction to Web Development

description: Learn how to create a web application using Django and AngularJS. Django and AngularJS are both very popular frameworks for web development.
name: Web Development with Django and AngularJS

description: Starting a new JavaScript project from scratch is overwhelming. This course provides a playbook outlining the key decisions you need to make. Build a robust development environment that handles bundling, linting, transpiling, testing, and much more.
name: Building a JavaScript Development Environment

description: This course covers web part development for SharePoint 2010, 2013, and 2016 on-premises farms. It goes from basic topics to advanced tips and techniques.
name: SharePoint Web Part Development

description: This course is a guide to kick-starting a career in front end web development that addresses the need-to-know terms, topics, and concepts for an industry professional.
name: Front End Web Development Career Kickstart

description: So much software. So little time. Revisit the LIVE sessions that cut through the noise.
name: Pluralsight LIVE 2018: Get Your Geek On (Software Development)

description: This course will equip you with the knowledge needed to build, test, deploy, and scale Node.js web applications in production on Amazon Web Services.
name: Zero to Production Node.js on Amazon Web Services

description: There's a set of technologies, which when used together, supercharge web apps so they can compete with native apps. This course will introduce each of them, and teach you to convert existing apps into Progressive Web Apps - and to engage users.
name: Progressive Web App Fundamentals

description: Course on web development with express.js, a lightweight Sinatra-based web framework for node.js
name: Web Development with ExpressJS

description: ASP.NET Core is a mature, stable platform for developing web applications and APIs. This course will walk you through building a web app from scratch using ASP.NET Core 2.1, Visual Studio 2017, Entity Framework Core 2.1, Bootstrap 4, and Angular (v6)
name: Building a Web App with ASP.NET Core, MVC, Entity Framework Core, ...

description: With Node.js, you can take your existing JavaScript knowledge and use that to build full-stack web applications. This course will teach you how to build out routing, databases, and third-party APIs in Node.js and Express.
name: Building Web Applications with Node.js and Express 4.0 (UPDATE)

description: If you watched my Web API Design course, you should know what a pragmatic RESTful API looks like. In this course I'll show you how to implement it in ASP.NET Web API
name: Implementing an API in ASP.NET Web API

description: This course is designed for beginners to understand how to Build Web App using Spring MVC, Hibernate, Spring Security, AOP, REST & Spring WebFlow. Upon completion, the viewer will be in a position to start developing a basic web app using Spring MVC.
name: Building Web App Using Spring MVC, Hibernate, Bootstrap, and REST Services

description: Microsoft has many options for tackling web development. This course will explain what the available options are and how to determine which is best for you!
name: A Comparison of Microsoft Web Technologies

description: This course focuses on the touch points between an Angular front-end client application and a back-end service built with ASP.NET Web API.
name: AngularJS Front to Back with Web API

description: This course will help you make the web a better place by designing easy to use forms that encourage form completion.
name: Best Practices for Responsive Web-forms

description: Implementing Authentication and Authorization in ASP.NET Web API v2.
name: Web API v2 Security

description: Node.js is a simple and powerful tool for backend development. When combined with Express, you can create lightweight, fast, scalable APIs quickly and simply. With REST, those APIs become simple and user-friendly to make your APIs more usable.
name: RESTful Web Services with Node.js and Express

description: Have you always wanted to see how professional, experienced developers build an application from A to Z? This course will show you how. You'll build a real-world mini social networking application with ASP.NET MVC 5 and Entity Framework 6.
name: Become a Full-stack .NET Developer

description: Starting a new JavaScript project from scratch is overwhelming. This course provides a playbook outlining the key decisions you need to make. Build a robust development environment that handles bundling, linting, transpiling, testing, and much more.
name: Building a JavaScript Development Environment

description: JavaScript is one of the easiest languages to get started with and one of the most powerful -- it'll challenge you to learn more even years after you start.
name: Basics of Programming with JavaScript

description: For the beginner, starting to learn web development can be daunting. In this course, Shawn Wildermuth shows you step-by-step how to use client-side web development techniques to create immersive web sites.
name: Front-End Web Development Quick Start With HTML5, CSS, and JavaScript

description: Gain an advanced understanding of the core mechanics of how JavaScript compiles, optimizes, and executes in the browser.
name: Advanced JavaScript

description: This course will teach you the core Node.js concepts and API modules from simple utility modules all the way to streams and clusters.
name: Advanced Node.js

description: Writing "bad" JavaScript is easy. Fortunately, writing "good" JavaScript is not too much harder. In this course, I will show you tried and true design patterns to help structure and organize your code to make your JavaScript code more readable and maintainable.
name: Practical Design Patterns in JavaScript

description: Throughout this series of JavaScript tutorials we'll learn how to write the programming language from scratch, so you can start creating code of your own. Software required: Mozilla Firefox.
name: Quick Start to JavaScript: Volume 1

description: Stay updated by learning about the latest upgrade to the JavaScript language--ES6, also known as ECMAScript 2015. In this course, you will learn how to develop software using many kinds of classes and modules.
name: Object-oriented Programming in JavaScript - ES6

description: Learn JavaScript rapidly in a direct question and answer format. You'll see hundreds of examples which cover most aspects of the language.
name: Rapid JavaScript Training

description: Solidify your knowledge of objects, arrays, and prototypes in JavaScript. Master closures, use higher-order functions/callbacks, and learn underscore.js.
name: JavaScript: From Fundamentals to Functional JS

description: This course teaches the in-depth, behind-the-scenes details of creating JavaScript objects, manipulating properties, and using prototypal inheritance.
name: JavaScript Objects and Prototypes

description: Learn JavaScript with no prior programming experience
name: JavaScript From Scratch

description: Learn how to bend data to your will with this powerful data visualization library in D3.js version 3.
name: D3.js Data Visualization Fundamentals

description: Gain an advanced understanding of difficult JavaScript concepts like closure, new, “this”, prototypical inheritance, type comparators, coercion, and delete.
name: JavaScript: Advanced Fundamentals to jQuery & Pure DOM Scripting

description: In this second Volume of the Quick Start to JavaScript tutorial, we'll learn more methods of control flow like switch statements, for loops, and while loops. Software required: Mozilla Firefox, Brackets, Google Chrome.
name: Quick Start to JavaScript: Volume 2

description: Learn to build a web application with React and Flux on the frontend, Rails as your API backend server, and tools like Webpack and Bable.js for ES6.
name: React.js on Rails: Building a Full Stack Web App

description: Most developers have to dive into JavaScript at some point. This course will help you map your C# skills to JavaScript. With Node.js, Web Development and WinRT all requiring JavaScript, C# developers need to know this important language.
name: JavaScript for C# Developers

description: Understanding the security risks that threatens a Node.js web application is crucial to its success. This course aims at providing functional mitigations to apply to your application against those vulnerabilities.
name: Securing Your Node.js Web App

description: Identify and prevent common problems and headaches in JavaScript by learning best practices. From syntax oddities, to async patterns, to callbacks, this course will help you walk through how to deal with some of JavaScript's problem spots.
name: JavaScript Best Practices

description: Learn how to take your JavaScript skills to the next level with Asynchronous Module Definition. In this course, you'll learn to simplify JavaScript development by organizing code into modules that are maintainable, explainable, and trainable.
name: JavaScript Asynchronous Module Definition (AMD) Explained

description: Backbone.js is a set of tools that gives structure to client-side web applications. It helps us write clean, maintainable JavaScript applications.
name: Backbone.js Fundamentals

description: In this course, viewers will learn how to develop WebGL applications using the Three.js library.
name: WebGL and Three.js Fundamentals

description: In this course, we build two applications to highlight the power of Ember.js from the basics all the way through to moderately advanced topics.
name: Ember.js Fundamentals

description: In this course we provide an overview of Node.js, including writing asynchronous code with callbacks and streams, and modularizing your application with NPM and require(). We also look at built-in API's for building and scaling web applications as well as a few key third party modules.
name: Introduction to Node.js

description: This course covers the features of ECMAScript 6, the next version of JavaScript, and how you can use them today.
name: JavaScript Fundamentals for ES6

description: This course provides thorough coverage of the core Java platform, giving you the skills needed to begin developing in the Java Runtime Environment (JRE) and serving as a solid foundation for all Java-based development environments.
name: Java Fundamentals: The Core Platform

description: This course provides complete coverage of the Java programming language and serves as a strong foundation for all Java-based development environments including client-based, server-side, and Android.
name: Java Fundamentals: The Java Language

description: A quick overview of most of the new features of Java 8. The course covers lambda expressions and the Stream API but also many new additions scattered all around the JDK. JavaFX and Nashorn are also quickly covered.
name: What's New in Java 8

description: This course shows the new patterns introduced in Java 8, based on lambda expressions, the functional interfaces, the Collection Framework and the Stream API.
name: From Collections to Streams in Java 8 Using Lambda Expressions

description: To build web applications in Java, you need to understand the libraries and concepts that underly the higher level frameworks, and this course helps you to do that. The course covers writing a web application in Java using Servlets, JavaServer Pages, and tag libraries.
name: Java Web Fundamentals

description: Today most programs have a concurrent element and knowledge of concurrency is vital. This course will teach you how to use the Java libraries to achieve concurrency via multithreading.
name: Java Fundamentals - Concurrency with Multithreading

description: This course functions as a technical and business overview of Java Enterprise Edition.
name: Java EE: The Big Picture

description: Learn why you would want to use collections instead of arrays and understand the power of Lists, Sets, and Maps.
name: Java Fundamentals: Collections

description: Developing web apps just got easier. In this course, you'll learn the essentials of developing web applications with Java EE 7.
name: Java EE 7 Fundamentals

description: Simply programming in an OO language does not make your program object oriented. This course teaches you how to leverage essential object-oriented principles to write solid, maintainable code, while avoiding common pitfalls.
name: Java Fundamentals: Object-oriented Design

description: This course shows advanced patterns to process data in Java 8 using lambdas, streams, spliterators, optionals, and collectors. It shows how to build your own spliterators to connect streams to non-standard data sources, and to build your own collectors.
name: Streams, Collectors, and Optionals for Data Processing in Java 8

description: Java servlets are the first step to understanding web programming using Java, and this course will show you the basics of servlet architecture and applying filters to more complex issues like debugging and deployment.
name: Java EE: Programming Servlets

description: Deliver software faster than ever. This course will teach you core Java microservices patterns including centralized configuration, asynchronous tasks, service authorization, and request tracing.
name: Java Microservices with Spring Cloud: Developing Services

description: JavaServer Faces is the Java EE standard component-based web application framework. This course will teach you how to use JSF to build a complete web application, including building the user interface and business logic.
name: Java EE: Getting Started with JavaServer Faces

description: If you want to be able to write multi-threaded Java apps, this course is for you. You'll learn about problems with concurrent programming on multicore CPU, and false sharing. You'll also be introduced to the Java Memory model and more.
name: Applying Concurrency and Multi-threading to Common Java Patterns

description: In this unscripted and unrehearsed Pluralsight play-by-play, you will delve into the basic and advanced concepts of Docker from a Java Developer's perspective, including Docker fundamentals, Docker Compose and Docker Swarm.
name: Play by Play: Docker for Java Developers with Arun Gupta and Michael Hoffman

description: Learn to incorporate some tools and concepts from functional programming into Java code, both in Java 8 and earlier versions.
name: Functional Programming With Java

description: Java Server Pages is a technology that helps software developers to create platform independent dynamic web applications rapidly. This course will teach you how to use Java Server Pages to develop web based applications in simple and easy steps.
name: Java EE: Java Server Pages

description: This course will provide you with a quick introduction to basic JavaFX features and help you build your first JavaFX Application.
name: Java SE: Building Your First JavaFX Application

description: Java applications can often suffer from memory problems such as an OutOfMemoryError. This course shows you how to fix them using freely available tools.
name: Understanding and Solving Java Memory Problems

description: A course for all the Java Developers who want to work with JDBC Programming.
name: Java Platform: Working with Databases Using JDBC

description: Learn how to map Java objects to a relational database in your Java SE and Java EE applications.
name: Java Persistence API (JPA) 2.1

description: Distributed systems and multi-core platforms are far too prevalent now to dismiss everyday concurrency. This course outlines several concurrency patterns that the Java Concurrency API simplifies, making it much easier to scale your Java application.
name: Scaling Java Applications Through Concurrency

description: Get a first look at the all-new Java module system. In this course, you'll learn about modularity concepts such as encapsulation and explicit module dependencies, as well as how to migrate your existing code to Java 9.
name: Java 9 Modularity: First Look

description: Kotlin is a lanuage that compiles to Java bytecode and runs on the JVM; it's designed to address many of Java's shortcomings. This course aims to give you an introduction to Kotlin to get you developing applications quickly.
name: Getting Started with Kotlin
